predictions.text: U.S. Core PCE Price Index (MoM, SA) for November 2025 will print between +0.1% and +0.3%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via BEA 'Personal Income and Outlays, November 2025' news release: the Core PCE Price Index monthly percent change (seasonally adjusted) must be >= +0.1% and <= +0.3%.
evidence: Recent trend of core disinflation with monthly prints near 0.2%.
MarketWatch: Consumers entering holidays with spending plans intact.
Fed communication consistent with gradual inflation cooling into year-end.
monitoring_signals: BLS CPI core services ex-housing momentum vs PCE translation factors.
High-frequency card data and retail discounting intensity.
Unit labor cost revisions and productivity data.
predictions.rationale: Core PCE has been running near 0.2% MoM; discounting and slower shelter pass-through support a 0.1–0.3% outcome.

predictions.text: U.S. Advance Retail and Food Services Sales (headline, MoM, SA) for November 2025 will print between -0.3% and +0.3%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via U.S. Census Bureau 'Advance Monthly Retail and Food Services Sales' for Nov 2025: headline percent change from prior month (seasonally adjusted) must be within -0.3% to +0.3%.
evidence: MarketWatch: Consumers remain resilient heading into holidays, but margins tight.
Lower gasoline prices can dampen nominal sales despite steady real demand.
monitoring_signals: Gasoline prices and volumes (EIA product supplied).
predictions.rationale: Holiday spending looks steady but not exuberant; fuel price declines and discounting likely flatten the nominal headline.

predictions.text: India CPI (Combined, YoY) for November 2025 will print between 4.6% and 5.4%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via India NSO CPI (Combined) November 2025 press release: the all-India headline YoY inflation rate must be within 4.6%–5.4%.
evidence: CNBC: India GDP grew 8.2%, domestic demand strong.
Food inflation volatility moderating from prior spikes; core relatively contained.
monitoring_signals: High-frequency food price indices (vegetables, cereals, pulses).
Fuel price adjustments and LPG subsidies.
RBI commentary and expectations from surveys.
predictions.rationale: Strong growth with moderating food pressures suggests CPI near but above RBI’s 4% target, within a mid-4s to mid-5s band.

predictions.text: EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report will show U.S. commercial crude oil stocks (excluding SPR) declining by at least 8.0 million barrels in at least one report by 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report: any weekly report published through 2025-12-31 shows 'Crude Oil (Excl. SPR) change' <= -8.0 million barrels from prior week.
evidence: Year-end swings from exports and refinery runs can trigger large draws.
Prospect of OPEC+ action supports stronger export pull and runs.
monitoring_signals: Refinery utilization rates and crude runs (PADD 3).
Net crude imports/exports and SPR adjustments.
predictions.rationale: Seasonal year-end dynamics and firm export demand create tail risk for an 8+ million barrel draw in one of the December weeks.

predictions.text: ICE Arabica Coffee (KC) front-month futures will settle at or above 230.00 cents/lb on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via ICE Futures U.S. official settlement prices: the front-month Arabica Coffee contract settles >= 230.00 c/lb on any trading day through 2025-12-31 (UTC).
evidence: CNBC: Coffee prices near multi-decade highs amid supply constraints.
Tight ICE certified stocks and weather risks in Brazil/Colombia.
monitoring_signals: ICE certified stock levels and grading activity.
Brazil rainfall anomalies and CONAB updates.
USD index (DXY) and BRL exchange rate.
predictions.rationale: Supply constraints and weather risk into year-end keep upside tails; a single 230+ c/lb settle is plausible.

predictions.text: The U.S. 2s10s Treasury yield spread (FRED: T10Y2Y) will close at or above 0.00% on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via FRED series T10Y2Y daily close: any value >= 0.00% on or before 2025-12-31 counts.
evidence: Late-year rallies have compressed long-end yields; steepening risk lingers.
Potential Fed policy signaling may lift front-end cut expectations.
monitoring_signals: Treasury refunding and term premium proxies.
predictions.rationale: A modest steepening impulse from policy or growth surprises could briefly erase inversion before year-end.

predictions.text: CISA will add at least 10 CVEs to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog with Date Added between 2025-12-16 and 2025-12-31 inclusive.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via CISA KEV catalog (JSON or web): count of entries with 'Date Added' between 2025-12-16 and 2025-12-31 inclusive is >= 10.
evidence: KEV additions often cluster around vendor advisories and post-Patch Tuesday discoveries.
Seasonal end-of-year disclosures can elevate counts.
monitoring_signals: Vendor emergency advisories (e.g., Cisco, VMware, Atlassian, Adobe).
Exploit kit activity and ransomware TTP reports.
predictions.rationale: Even with holidays, exploited vulns are frequently backfilled into KEV after mid-month as exploitation is confirmed.

predictions.text: The EU will announce at least one new Iran-related sanctions designation by 2025-12-31 via an official Council press release or the Official Journal.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified by a Council of the EU press release and/or publication in the Official Journal listing new Iran-related designations between now and 2025-12-31.
evidence: Heightened regional tensions and allied (US/UK) Iran designations increase EU action likelihood.
EU routinely refreshes restrictive measures before year-end meetings.
monitoring_signals: FAC agendas and Council press room updates.
predictions.rationale: Coordinated transatlantic pressure and year-end Council cycles make at least one Iran-related addition plausible.

predictions.text: Cboe VIX will close at or below 11.50 on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified using Cboe VIX historical close data: any daily close price <= 11.50 on or before 2025-12-31 (UTC) counts.
evidence: MarketWatch: Best Thanksgiving week since 2008; S&P near records.
Year-end seasonality often suppresses implied volatility absent shocks.
monitoring_signals: Realized vol (20d) vs implied vol spread.
predictions.rationale: Calm macro and supportive liquidity can briefly push VIX into the low 11s before year-end.

predictions.text: Euro area (EA20) S&P Global Manufacturing PMI Final for November 2025 will print between 46.0 and 48.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via S&P Global press release/data for EA20 Manufacturing PMI Final (Nov 2025): headline index value must be within 46.0–48.0.
evidence: Euro manufacturing remains subdued amid weak external demand and tight financial conditions.
Energy prices and Germany’s industrial softness cap improvements.
monitoring_signals: Flash PMI and national PMIs (DE, FR, IT, ES).
ZEW/Ifo surveys and new orders components.
Energy price dynamics (TTF) and export orders.
predictions.rationale: Incremental stabilization but still contractionary; final typically tracks flash closely within a narrow band.

predictions.text: Cisco PSIRT will publish at least one security advisory in December 2025 with a CVSS v3.x Base Score >= 9.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via security-advisories.cisco.com: any advisory dated 2025-12-01 to 2025-12-31 includes CVSS v3.x Base Score >= 9.0 (Critical).
evidence: Vendors often issue critical advisories around Patch Tuesday or out-of-band fixes.
Cisco historically posts multiple high/critical advisories quarterly.
monitoring_signals: Cisco PSIRT RSS feed and Talos blog.
CISA KEV additions referencing Cisco products.
predictions.rationale: Large vendor footprint and ongoing exposure surface make at least one critical December advisory likely.

predictions.text: NOAA SWPC will issue at least one G2 (Moderate) geomagnetic storm Watch or Warning by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via NOAA SWPC alerts/archive: any G2 (Moderate) geomagnetic storm Watch or Warning issued between now and 2025-12-31 (UTC) satisfies the condition.
evidence: Airbus: heightened solar radiation impacted avionics data integrity, implying elevated space weather.
Solar maximum increases frequency of G2+ events.
monitoring_signals: Sunspot number and 10.7 cm solar flux.
predictions.rationale: At solar maximum, G2 watches/warnings are common; recent solar activity affecting aviation suggests sustained elevated conditions.
